entry.title: Re: VS Code SAP WEB CLIENT Extensibility
entry.content:
Hello Prasanth,

First of all, thank you for your detailed response.
It was very clear, and the samples were perfect to help us understand your explanation.
We are really trying to change our mindset towards the Web Client, but some things are still not very clear at these initial stages.

Regarding the "bait and switch" solution ‚Äî you might not believe it, but this was exactly (step by step) what we did! We hid the native "Save" button, added our own "Save" button, performed our validations when it was pressed, and after that we called the SAP "Save" method.

That was our Plan B if there was no other solution... so we weren‚Äôt as far off as we thought!

Thank you very much!

entry.title: NWBC Error after Patch Implementation - Wrong caching in NWBC_NAV_TREE
entry.content:
Since the last patch implementation in our (clinical) system with severeal dialog instances and an integrated Web Dispatcher, we have been experiencing an issue when using NWBC.

When launching a tile, the following error may occur:

partner ‚Äòhostname:port‚Äô not reached
WASECONNREFUSED: Connection refused
Would you like a detailed error description?

It is noticeable that the hostname:port combination shown in the error message is incorrect ‚Äî it‚Äôs a mix of two correct values:

The hostname always refers to the server where the user was previously logged in.

The port value, however, correctly refers to the current server where the user is logged in.

We were able to narrow the issue down to what seems to be a faulty cache.

After running the report /UI2/INVALIDATE_GLOBAL_CACHES, which among other things clears the table NWBC_NAV_TREE, the issue disappears ‚Äî but only temporarily. The first login to the initial dialog instance works fine. However, after logging into a different dialog instance, the error reappears.

We have had an open ticket with SAP for over two weeks now, but unfortunately, support has not yet understood the problem. We repeatedly receive suggestions pointing to a supposed network configuration or connection issue. The problem has been described in detail in writing and with screenshots; earlier today I even explained it in a Teams call. After one hour, the support engineer asked for the output of

niping -v -h hostname ‚Äî without specifying from which host to which this should be executed. Two escalations have not improved the situation.

Since the beginning of this week, we are working with a temporary workaround:

A custom enhancement deletes the user-specific entries in table NWBC_NAV_TREE whenever a tile is clicked.

The following patches were implemented:
IS-H 618: SP 43
HR 608: SP 145 ‚Üí 148
EA-HR 608: SP 145 ‚Üí 148
SAP_GWFND 750 SP33
SAP_BASIS 750 SP33
SAP_ABA 750 SP33
SAP_BW 750 SP33
SAP_UI 754 SP17

Has anyone experienced a similar or identical issue?

Thanks
Matthias

entry.title: Re: How to get the Inventory Value for the Free of Charge...
entry.content:
Creating a separate material for Free of Charge (FOC) items and posting with movement type 501 is a valid approach, but SAP offers alternative methods that may better support valuation tracking without duplicating material master data.

Below are the recommended options

With Valuation Type, you can distinguish FOC stock from purchased stock. One valuation type for purchased stock and another for FOC stock. This allows tracking inventory value separately while using the same material.

Create a PO with FOC indicator (checkbox in PO item). GR is posted with movement type 101, but no value is posted. Inventory quantity increases, but valuation remains unaffected.

Add a statistical condition (e.g., NR00) to indicate FOC value. Helps in reporting and audit trails without affecting actual valuation.
 
For valuation reporting, use FIFO valuation app or moving average price to reflect actual consumption and cost trends. Helps in understanding how FOC stock affects overall inventory value. Please go through this SAP Help FIFO Valuation

entry.title: Re: Implement Internal Order objects with budget control...
entry.content:
I‚Äôd like to provide clarity regarding the availability of Internal Orders in S/4HANA Public Cloud systems. Please note that Internal Orders are no longer supported in S/4HANA Public Cloud systems. From the SAP Help Portal: CO - Internal order (restricted)  

As an alternative, the recommended solution is to use Enterprise Projects, which can be managed using applications such as Project Control - Enterprise Projects and Project Planning.

Additionally, if you wish to utilize the Budget Availability Control for Projects feature included in Enterprise Projects, you can do so by working with Statistical or Overhead Projects. For further guidance and detailed documentation, you can explore the SAP Help Portal using the following link:

SAP Help Portal:
Project Control - Enterprise Projects
Budget Availability Control for Projects

entry.title: Re: Send default HTTP200 from SAP APIM
entry.content:
Hi Diptee, what exactly is meant with "irrespective of the backend response (error or success)."

1) There are HTTP status codes: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes
Is the requirement to always return 200  instead of 400, 401, 404, 500, ...?
If so, this is a bad requirement. It is a violation against the HTTP protocol and makes error analysis difficult, cumbersome, impossible.

2) You have errors while processing the request in your application (CPI iFlows). Then, the request was transferred correctly and you could return 200 e.g. with error messages in the response body.
My opinion, not a good idea, the client does not notice, that there was an issue. All frameworks would just take the response and were happy with it. The client application must take over error handling completely. I would return something from the 400 codes.
Same as in 1) applies here: makes error analysis difficult, cumbersome, impossible.

entry.title: SAP Fiori Elements Funktion Import Copy Row
entry.content:
I have a Fiori Elements app with a list report page and an object page. When I click the Copy one Row button on the list report page, a new row with the same values as the selected row is created. I am then automatically redirected to the object page, where I can edit the data in the new row. However, when I click Cancel, the new row is still displayed in the list even though I have not saved the data. How can I prevent this behavior?

  METHOD /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~execute_action.
    DATA : ls_parameter        TYPE /iwbep/s_mgw_name_value_pair,
           ls_zleiter_ausnahme TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_result           TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_entity           TYPE  zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>ts_leiterausnahmen,
           lt_entityset        TYPE zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>tt_leiterausnahmen.

    IF iv_action_name = 'CopyRow'.

      "read parameters
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO ls_parameter WITH KEY name = 'LA_ID'.
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO DATA(ls_keys_app) WITH KEY name = 'APP_ID'.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id = ls_parameter-value.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id = ls_keys_app-value.


      "select new values
      "do you know - even if you haven't yet committed the changes,
      "system will return new data
      "search 'transaction isolation levels' to read more on this
      SELECT SINGLE * FROM zleiter_ausnahme
        WHERE  la_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id AND app_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id
        INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF @LS_result .
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        SELECT MAX( la_id ) FROM zleiter_ausnahme INTO @DATA(lv_id).
        ADD 1 TO lv_id.
        ls_result-la_id = lv_id.
        ls_result-la_datum = sy-datum.
        ls_result-la_aenderer = sy-uname.
     MODIFY zleiter_ausnahme FROM ls_result.

        DATA: ls_entityset LIKE LINE OF lt_entityset.

*      ls_entityset-aenderer = ls_result-la_aenderer.
        ls_entityset-aenderer = sy-uname.
        ls_entityset-bemerkung = ls_result-la_bemerkung.
*      ls_entityset-date = ls_result-la_datum.
        ls_entityset-date = sy-datum.
        ls_entityset-datefrom = ls_result-la_datum_von.
        ls_entityset-dateto = ls_result-la_datum_bis.
        ls_entityset-int2 = ls_result-la_id.
        ls_entityset-kostl = ls_result-la_kostl.
        ls_entityset-ktr = ls_result-la_ktr.
        ls_entityset-mandt = ls_result-mandt.
        ls_entityset-username = ls_result-la_nutzer.
        ls_entityset-int1 = ls_result-app_id.
        ls_entityset-app_description = ls_result-app_bezeichnung.

      APPEND ls_entityset TO lt_entityset.

* call methos copy_data_to_ref and export entity set data
        copy_data_to_ref( EXPORTING is_data = ls_entityset

                CHANGING cr_data = er_data ).
      ELSE.
        "Fehlerbehandlung - Quellrecord nicht gefunden
        RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
          EXPORTING
            textid  = /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception=>business_error
            message = 'Quelldatensatz nicht gefunden'.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF .
**TRY.
*CALL METHOD SUPER->/IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~EXECUTE_ACTION
**  EXPORTING
**    iv_action_name          =
**    it_parameter            =
**    io_tech_request_context =
**  IMPORTING
**    er_data                 =
*    .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_tech_exception .
**ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: 5 pontos essenciais para o fechamento da fase DEPLOY em projetos SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
A fase DEPLOY √© o momento mais esperado de toda a jornada SAP Activate ‚Äî √© onde a solu√ß√£o finalmente entra em opera√ß√£o. Mas o sucesso dessa virada depende de um encerramento bem estruturado, capaz de garantir uma transi√ß√£o est√°vel, usu√°rios treinados e governan√ßa ativa para o per√≠odo p√≥s-Go-Live.

O fechamento dessa etapa n√£o representa apenas o final do projeto, mas o in√≠cio de uma nova fase: a ado√ß√£o cont√≠nua e sustent√°vel da solu√ß√£o SAP.

O Roadmap da metodologia SAP Activate apresenta informa√ß√µes bem completas para apoio nesse momento. Mas caso precise de um guia para refer√™ncia r√°pida, deixo abaixo os 5 pontos chave que devem ser considerados neste momento. Como mais refer√™ncias, deixo ao final deste post o link para o Roadmap completo.

A seguir, compartilho os 5 pontos principais que devem ser observados no encerramento do DEPLOY:

1. Go-Live Executado e Estabiliza√ß√£o Iniciada

O Go-Live deve ocorrer com acompanhamento pr√≥ximo da equipe do projeto e foco total em estabilidade.

  • Transi√ß√£o planejada conforme o Cutover Plan

  • Suporte ativo nos primeiros dias de opera√ß√£o (Hypercare)

  • Monitoramento cont√≠nuo de incidentes e performance

Esse √© o momento de transformar planejamento em resultados concretos.

2. Processos Operacionais Estabilizados

O sistema deve estar operando de forma est√°vel e dentro dos padr√µes de neg√≥cio definidos.

  • Processos cr√≠ticos testados em ambiente produtivo

  • Indicadores de performance acompanhados

  • Corre√ß√µes emergenciais tratadas e controladas

O objetivo aqui √© confirmar que a opera√ß√£o est√° pronta para seguir sem depend√™ncia total da equipe de projeto.

3. Treinamento e Suporte ao Usu√°rio Final

O sucesso do Go-Live tamb√©m depende da ado√ß√£o pelos usu√°rios.

  • Aprova√ß√£o do cliente e aceite formal (Project Closure)

Esse √© o marco que confirma a conclus√£o bem-sucedida do projeto e libera as equipes para a fase de suporte cont√≠nuo.

5. Transi√ß√£o para Suporte e Opera√ß√£o Cont√≠nua

Conclus√£o

Com transi√ß√£o estruturada, governan√ßa ativa e foco em ado√ß√£o, o projeto consolida o valor entregue pelo SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, transformando implementa√ß√£o em resultados de neg√≥cio reais.

entry.title: Re: Inactive user in RBP group
entry.content:
Hi Khaja20,

 

As per KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/2784357 it is an expected behavior for inactive users to be displayed on the Permission Group if it uses username People Pool filter. This is considered a static permission group and data is maintained manually by an admin.

Static Permission group always includes inactive users, as the target population may include inactive users depending on the organization's setup. This is the same for the search logic in Static Role-Based Permissions. If the end user was inactive before the group was created, it cannot be searched.

For static permission groups, what is seen is not the group membership but the group definition. Changes on the user data will not touch the group definition but the group membership. The group membership is the active group count which is seen on the upper hand right side of the permission group. It is always updated to include the active users only.

Please note that when granting permissions to users, only active users inherit the permissions. Hence, though an inactive user is listed, that user is never granted the role.

So the recommendation is to use dynamic groups and dynamic people pool filters on the permission group setup as these filters dynamically change based on the requirement and does not need manual maintenance on the admin's side. It automatically changes when the group filters and conditions are met. Inactive users will not be displayed as the group's criteria are updated automatically by the system.

 

Kind Regards,

Cristian

entry.title: 5 Essential Points for Successfully Closing DEPLOY in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Projects
entry.content:
The DEPLOY phase is the most anticipated moment in the SAP Activate methodology ‚Äî it‚Äôs when the solution finally goes live and becomes part of the organization‚Äôs daily operations.
However, a successful Go-Live depends on a structured closure that ensures stability, user adoption, and active governance for the post-Go-Live phase.

Closing this stage marks not just the end of the project, but the beginning of a new journey: sustainable adoption and continuous value realization with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

The SAP Activate Methodology Roadmap provides comprehensive information to support this stage. However, if you need a quick reference guide, below are the 5 key points that should be considered at this moment. For additional references, I‚Äôve included at the end of this post the link to the full Roadmap.

1. Go-Live Executed and Stabilization Initiated

The Go-Live should be executed with close coordination and full attention from the project team.

  • Transition completed according to the approved Cutover Plan

  • Active support during the first days (Hypercare)

  • Continuous monitoring of incidents and performance metrics

This is where the project truly delivers on its planning and effort.

2. Operational Processes Stabilized

The production system must be running smoothly and aligned with defined business standards.

  • Critical business processes validated in the production environment

  • Performance indicators actively monitored

  • Emergency fixes managed under controlled governance

The goal here is to ensure operations can continue reliably without constant project team intervention.

3. End-User Training and Support

The success of a Go-Live depends largely on user adoption.

  • End-user training sessions delivered and recorded

  • Support materials available (manuals, FAQs, tutorials)

  • Help desk and communication channels active

Even the best-designed solution can fail if end users are not well prepared.

4. Formal Project Closure

Every SAP project should end with a formal technical and administrative closure.

  • Lessons Learned documented and shared

  • Customer approval and official project sign-off

  • Risk register and deliverables updated

This milestone confirms the successful completion of the project and transitions ownership to the support organization.

5. Transition to Ongoing Support and Continuous Operations

A structured handover between the project team and the support organization is essential for business continuity.

  • Processes, access, and responsibilities formally transferred

  • Contracts and SLAs reviewed and confirmed

  • Governance established for continuous monitoring and improvement

This handover ensures the system continues to evolve under the Clean Core principle ‚Äî stable, adaptable, and ready for innovation.

Conclusion

Successfully closing the DEPLOY phase means ensuring a stable Go-Live, well-trained users, and a seamless transition to continuous operations.

With structured transition, active governance, and focus on adoption, the project consolidates its value delivery through SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, transforming implementation into sustainable business outcomes.

Link to the SAP Activate Roadmap related to this phase:

https://me.sap.com/roadmapviewer/group/658F507A-D6F5-4B78-9EE1-0300C5F1E40F/roadmapcontentpage/a11ec6d657054bf9:FA163EAF25B21EEB8FC47DE9E728E8DB

entry.title: Stay Current with SAP SuccessFactors Succession Planning ‚Äì 2H 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP SuccessFactors Community!‚Äã

The second half of 2025 delivers focused enhancements in Succession Planning, expanding AI-assisted successor recommendations, standardizing APIs across nomination methods, tightening permission controls, and improving planner usability in the org chart and talent pools.‚Äã

This blog summarizes the key Succession updates with configuration tips, prerequisites, and why each change matters for scalable, governed talent planning.‚Äã

Succession highlights‚Äã

  1. OData V4 everywhere: NominationService.svc now supports role-person and legacy position-based methods, not just MDF, enabling create/update/delete for successors and pool nominations via a single API pattern.‚Äã

  2. AI-generated successors: Up to 10 recommended candidates based on job profiles, skills/competencies, and work history, with clear rationales and quick-add from the org chart or position tile.‚Äã

  3. Growth Portfolio intelligence: Suggested Successors calculates role readiness using Growth Portfolio proficiencies and explains matched vs. unmatched attributes aligned to Career Worksheet logic.‚Äã

  4. History access controls: Separate permissions for viewing nomination history of positions and talent pools improve governance and reporting/API alignment.‚Äã

  5. Smarter org chart sorting: Sort peers by position title or employee title for consistent, meaningful layouts tailored to the nomination method.‚Äã

  6. Include inactive employees: A new child setting lets target population logic include inactive users in talent pool workflows, cards, and searches.‚Äã

OData V4 API expansion‚Äã

Customers using role-person or legacy position-based nominations can use NominationService.svc (V4) to manage successor and talent pool nominations, standardizing integrations across methods.‚Äã

  • Why it matters: One service for all nomination models reduces custom logic and simplifies extensions and middleware flows.‚Äã

  • Permissions: Ensure Talent Pool view/edit/delete permissions align with intended API actions for pools and successors.‚Äã

AI-assisted successor recommendation‚Äã

Planners can trigger the Generate feature on the Succession Org Chart or Position Tile to receive recommendations based on job profile fit, skills, competencies, and job history. The results persist for three days and can be regenerated.‚Äã

  • Experience: See ranked suggestions with rationales, hover to quick-add as successors, and receive notifications when results are ready.‚Äã

  • Requirements: TIH with Growth Portfolio, AI units license with usage acknowledgment, enable Suggested Successors, activate via SAP support and AI Services Administration.‚Äã

In the suggested successors list, users can hover over an employee and use the Add button to nominate them as a successor. Once the employee is nominated, they are removed from the list. Users can also choose the information icon to view why the employee is suggested in a popover dialog.

The AI-generated content is stored on the position card for three days, after which it expires and becomes invisible. Users can regenerate the content at any time.

Here's a screenshot of this feature:

Suggested Successors enhancements‚Äã

Role readiness uses Growth Portfolio expected levels and actual proficiencies to compute readiness with an explanation of matched and unmatched attributes.‚Äã

  • UI changes: ‚ÄúReadiness‚Äù is renamed to ‚ÄúRole Readiness‚Äù in lists and dialogs to avoid confusion with general successor readiness status.‚Äã

  • Enablement: Turn on Suggested Successors to surface readiness explanations and Growth Portfolio-based calculations.‚Äã

  • Here's a screenshot of a role readiness explanation:

Nomination history permissions‚Äã

Two child permissions (for positions and for talent pools) provide fine-grained control over who can view nomination history, inheriting target population from parent permissions.‚Äã

  • Benefits: Protects sensitive changes, supports analysis through NomineeHistory (v2), and aligns visibility across cards, People Profile, and APIs.‚Äã

  • Rollout note: 2H 2025 grants corresponding history access to users of existing parent permissions by default.‚Äã

Org chart sorting options‚Äã

Admins can sort same-level nodes alphabetically by position title or employee title instead of username, improving planner orientation and report consistency.‚Äã

  • Configuration: Set Sort by position title for MDF/legacy position-based methods, or Sort by employee title for role-person method in Org Chart Configuration.‚Äã

  • Governance: Requires Manage System Properties for Org Chart Configuration.‚Äã

The following screenshots show the default sorting and the new sorting, respectively.

Succession Org Chart Sorted by Username (Default)

Inactive users in talent pools‚Äã

A new child option under ‚ÄúApply target population to talent pool nominations‚Äù allows including inactive employees within the defined target population.‚Äã

  • Where it applies: Talent pools, position cards, talent card nomination sections, latest People Profile card/legacy block, and pool search results.‚Äã

  • Path: Admin Center > Nominations Setup > Apply target population to talent pool nominations > Include inactive users in the target population.‚Äã

Related PM/GM intersections to note‚Äã

  • AI writing expansion: AI-assisted writing actions now extend to goals, improving the quality and consistency of feedback that often feeds talent discussions.‚Äã

  • Governance and lifecycle: DRTM precision for goals and template self-service in Manage Templates help keep related performance data clean and configurable around succession cycles

Please feel free to share your ideas and questions in the comment box of this blog. I‚Äôd be glad to share what I know with you. Also, do share your thoughts on the latest changes, and the features you valued the most. Share this blog with your colleagues.

Thank you!!

entry.title: Poor Performance in RAP Managed Scenario with INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE
entry.content:
Hi developers,

we encountered a performance issue in a managed RAP scenario. In our usecase a large set of around 100.000 records with 19 columns is updated through a RAP action. Only 3 of the 19 columns are changed during the action and we mark these columns in the %control structure for each record. Our system is onpremise S/4HANA 2023.

We noticed that the update to the database takes over 2 minutes. We traced the db access. RAP utilizes the class CL_CSP_SQL_ACCESS to write the data to the database. The UPDATE statement uses the addition INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE %control.

The generated SQL statement send to the database looks like this:

UPDATE "DBTAB"
SET
"COLUMN1" = CASE ? WHEN 1 THEN ? ELSE "COLUMN1" END,
"COLUMN2" = CASE ? WHEN 1 THEN ? ELSE "COLUMN2" END,
...
WHERE "CLIENT" ...

 The whole statement is divided into smaller packages.  The execution time is around 160 seconds for all packages.

As a workaround we set our entity to with unmanaged save with full data. Then we implemented the UPDATE ourself in the save_modified method:

IF update-entity IS NO INITIAL.
  UPDATE dbtab FROM TABLE @update-entity MAPPING FROM ENTITY.
ENDIF.

 The execution time is now around 1 second for the whole UPDATE statement. The with full data addition costs another 1-2 seconds for reading the missing data.

We also tried unmanaged save without with full data and with added INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE %control which confirmed the poor performance of managed save.

There is another topic to this performance issue and a blog post about the INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE, but both are closed:

https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-discussions/performance-implications-of-using-quot-set-indicators-quot/td-p/12660187 

https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/abap-sql-indicator-structures/ba-p/13496401

@ SAP: Are there any plans to improve performance of INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE or the managed database access?

@ community: has anybody noticed the same behaviour or any suggestions how to avoid this?

best regards
Christian

entry.title: Operators available in Regular Expressions (RegEx) in ABSL - hexadecimal values
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have a requirement to validate certain text fields by checking whether they contain any non-UTF-8 characters. For this purpose, we would like to use the built-in .FindRegex function for strings in ABSL. 

However, to achieve this, we need to reference the allowed characters by their hexadecimal values. Normally, this is done using escape tokens such as as \x or \u. For example, the following RegEx works correctly in standard implementations (see www.regex101.comüòû

[^\x{0000}-\x{c5be}]

Unfortunately, this expression does not seem to be interpreted correctly by ABSL. It appears that ABSL can interpret escape tokens to some extent ‚Äî for instance, the following RegEx works as expected:

[^\\x00-\\x99]

(The first backslash escapes the second one so that ABSL interprets it correctly.)

However, this pattern is limited to single-byte values only (from 00 fo FF) and we need to include all UTF-8 characters, which requires two-byte tokens such as the one in the earlier example.

I'm seeking general technical background information about the RegEx flavour used in C4C. Specifically, if it is based on PCRE2, because then it should support both \x63 and \x{0063} syntaxes. However, only the former seems to be recognized, which suggests either a different underlying standard is being used or there is an explicit limitation in functionality.

Could you please provide documentation or guidance on which operators are supported in ABSL for use in the .FindRegEx function?

Thank you and best regards,
Marek

SAP documentation says: ‚ÄúEnsure flexible workflow is activated before enabling versioning.‚Äù  Version Management in Purchase Contracts  This means you must activate flexible workflow for contracts. But even with workflow active, version history may not appear in the app UI.

Go to ME33K or ME3N to view version history. Backend versioning works reliably here.

With CDS view I_PurchaseContractVersion, build a Fiori Elements app or embedded analytics report to expose version data.

entry.title: Re: Assign Processes to Process responsibles in Signavio...
entry.content: Hello Angeliki, this use case is quite rare, as entries are typically expected to be mutually exclusive.‚Ä®However, there are two possible ways to achieve what you described: Option 1:‚Ä®You want to display the people who share the same role title within a single dictionary entry.‚Ä®Please note that in this setup, the role will appear in the process model together with all associated names - meaning you would not be linking to a specific person, but to the role itself.‚Ä®To implement this, you can create a custom attribute for the dictionary entries:‚Ä®Navigate to Process Manager Settings ‚Üí Define Notations & Attributes ‚Üí Dictionary, select the relevant dictionary category, and click ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù next to Custom Attribute to create a new one. Option 2:‚Ä®You create the same role multiple times, each time adding a short identifier or abbreviation.‚Ä®This way, the process model will show exactly which person is associated with the specific role.

entry.title: SAP BODS 4.3 Upgrade Issues
entry.content:
We have a upgraded SAP BODS from 4.2 version to SAP BODS 4.3 Version. The Upgrade is happening in new App servers and SQL Servers from the old servers. That is on perm to azure. All firewalls are open

Steps we took for migration

  1. Remove the job server association in SAP 4.2 (old environment) before taking a copy and
    set up the association again after.
  2. Backup the repo database
  3. Restore in new SQL server
  4. Upgrade the repo via repo manager
  5. Register the repo in server manager and CMS and given user required permissions

Now I am getting the error while opening the repo. I feel like some of the metadata in repo table are sitting with old authentications and it is not allowing to open the repo. When I am creating the new repo it is all working fine without any issues. I am able to connect to it finely Error I am getting connecting to repo.

entry.title: Material Documents Overview (F1077): Enhancing Features and Usability
entry.content:
Hello SAP users! Let's talk about some updates to the Material Documents Overview app (F1077) and new features designed to close the gaps between the older WebGUI application MB51 and the newer app. We want to thank everyone who shared their experience with the app‚Äîit really helps us make things better for you. The following updates are only relevant for the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. 

Closing Functional Gaps and Enhancing User Experience

SAP is not only working on closing the gaps between MB51 and the Material Documents Overview app but is also enhancing the user experience. The new app is designed to offer a smoother, more intuitive experience that makes it worthwhile to switch. Keep in mind that transitioning to this new app is essential, as the old app will eventually be deprecated.

FAQs Based on Your Feedback

We've gathered some frequently asked questions from customer feedback and are happy to answer them here:

Q: How can I add and arrange more columns and filter options?

A: Click the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù icon at the top of the list report table. Under ‚ÄúColumns,‚Äù enter your search term, like ‚Äúspecial stock type.‚Äù Check the boxes for the columns you want to add, then click ‚ÄúOK.‚Äù You can drag and drop to arrange columns as you like.

Q: How can I sort the list report?

A: Click the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù icon at the top of the list report table. Then click ‚ÄúSort‚Äù and pick how you want to sort the data, like by Plant, Storage Location, Material, or Batch. You can save your changes as a variant under "My views," and share it with others if you want.

Q: How can I see values such as Value in local Currency or the Signed quantity?

A: You either select the variant Material Document List with Values or click on setting and add the filter Value in local Currency and or Signed Quantity.

Q: How can I find or create a variant?

A: Select the dropdown menu for ‚ÄúSelect View‚Äù in the top left corner next to the Standard view ‚Äì choose a predelivered variant to see a different set of fields e. g. ‚ÄúMaterial Document List with Values‚Äù.

To create your own variant, add the filters that you want to the list view by clicking on the settings icon for the table. Select your filters and choose OK. If you want, you can also change the sequence of the columns by dragging and dropping them into place. When you have the columns arranged how you wish, click on the dropdown menu arrow for 'Select View' next to Standard and select Save As. Give your variant view a name and choose Save.

Q: Where can I find the Document Header Text or Reference field?

The Document Header Text field can be selected via the settings. The Reference field is called Delivery Note in the new app, and you can also find it via the settings. Both fields are available on the material document's detail page under the "General Information" section.

Q: Where can I see the complete set of information for a stock transfer including the issuing and receiving party?

A: In your filter bar, select filter "Include Auto-Created Item (Transfer)" and set it to "yes". You will then see two line entries. Alternatively, you can display all transfer related attributes in one line by selecting the according fields labelled with ‚Äútransfer‚Äù in the settings menu.

Q: How can I separate material code and description in Excel downloads?

A: Use the ‚ÄúExport‚Äù icon and choose ‚ÄúExport as.‚Äù Then select your format and destination. Make sure to check the ‚ÄúSplit cells with multiple values‚Äù box before you click ‚ÄúExport.‚Äù Your Excel file will then have separate columns for material descriptions and codes.

Wrap-Up

We‚Äôre focused on not only making the Material Documents Overview app better by addressing functional gaps but also improving the overall user experience. Your input is really important in helping us improve, and making the switch to the new app will ensure you're ready for when the old app is phased out.

Keep an eye on the official roadmap for more updates, and let us know your thoughts in the comments. Feel free to reach out with any questions. Thanks for being a part of this journey!

References:

Interested in more information on Inventory Management? Check out the following resource https://www.sap-press.com/inventory-management-with-sap-s4hana_6141/

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - What is Happening in Week 3
entry.content:
Hi everybody, the second week of Devtoberfest is almost over and we are heading into Week 3. This blog post should give you a good overview on what is happening in our third week of Devtoberfest.

Sessions for Week 3 (Oct 13 - Oct 17):

All sessions for Week 3 can be found in our Session Catalogue: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events

üü¢ ABAP (Monday)

  • What's new in RAP
  • ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse ‚Äì What's new
  • Evolving data integration with SQL services and CDS external entities
  • Discover the Latest Innovations in the ABAP Language

üü£ Tooling & Frontend (Tuesday)

  • Generate Process Artifacts by Importing BPMN Models from Any Process Design Tool
  • Roles and Authorization in SAP Build Process Automation: A Developer‚Äôs Guide
  • Supercharge SAP Build Process Automation with the UiPath Foundation Add-On
  • UI5 Middleware FE Mockserver in Practice ‚Äî Setup, Use Cases, Live Coding
  • Extend Fiori UIs in SAP Build: Empowering Adaptation Projects with Generative AI Capabilities
  • Use GenAI in Process Automation to Adapt 100s of Templates to Your Needs

üî¥Integration (Wednesday)

  • Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
  • Seamless Side-By-Side Extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
  • SAP Cloud ALM - Integration & Exception Monitoring for SAP Integration Suite

üîµData & AI (Thursday)

  • Bottom Line - Teaching Neural Networks with Snap!
  • Modernize your SAP Business Warehouse with SAP Business Data Cloud
  • Manage and Optimize Prompts in SAP AI Core: Concepts and Application
  • What‚Äôs new in AI Core Orchestration
  • SAP Data Products: how to handle them today and what is the plan for tomorrow?
  • Accelerate SAP CAP and Fiori Development with AI Tools
  • Behind the Magic: How Cirque du Soleil Reimagined Invoice Management with SAP Business AI

üü† CAP (Friday)

  • CAP Tools ‚Äì What's New and Hot
  • Best Practices in CAP
  • Testing SAP CAP Node.js apps with cds.test
  • SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant - Transforming with Gen AI

üü° Community (Friday)

  • How to Interview for an SAP Tech Job

Fun Activities - The SAP Puzzles

In week 3, we are launching the new and challenging SAP Puzzles! Head over to the Tutorial Navigator to solve the puzzles and earn points.

Here are links to the Puzzles:

  • üü° Devtoberfest 2025 - Coder's Challenge - ABAP Cloud
  • üü° Devtoberfest 2025 - Coder's Challenge - CAP Documentation (Capire!)

Validation of your session participation

At Devtoberfest, almost every activity earns you points against the Grand Prize in our competition. This is the case for your participation in the Devtoberfest sessions for each week. Every week we release validation tutorials for the different topic tracks ABAP, Tooling & Frontend, Integration, Data & AI, CAP, and the Community sessions. The validation tutorials can be found in our Tutorial Navigator. 

Be advised that assignment of Badges and Points take some time as we are batch processing these in a given interval.

entry.title: Re: Valuehelp for Migration
entry.content:
Hello @Simon_Lehnert 

For Product migration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, enter ISO codes (per UN/CEFACT) in the ‚ÄúBase Unit (ISO Format)‚Äù column‚Äîuse C62 for piece, KGM for kg, LTR for litre, MTR for meter, and HUR for hour, not SAP unit keys.

Templates need ISO codes instead of SAP UoM keys. SAP‚Äôs BH5 guide states migration objects ‚Äúuse ISO codes for UoM values,‚Äù so map to valid ISO codes during Convert Values / Value Mapping. SAP Press Data Migration To SAP S/4HANA From File (BH5)

Migration Cockpit treats UoM strictly according to ISO. SAP KBA 2907822 confirms UoM handling in the cockpit and typical mapping issues when ISO isn‚Äôt provided/linked. SAP Support Portal-2907822 - SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Unit of Measurement (UOM) Handling: Using ISO codes

Get the authoritative list from your tenant by pulling your configuration, as SAP provides standard units and ISO codes, and you maintain customer-specific ones. This is the source the system validates against.  SAP Help Portal-Developer Extensibility-Units of Measurement

Examples (cross-checked with UNECE Rec. 20): ‚Äúpiece/one‚Äù is C62; litre LTR; kilogram KGM; meter MTR; hour HUR‚Äîthese are UN/CEFACT common codes used by SAP. Unece:UnitMeasureCode

What to do (accurate and tenant-safe)

Migration Cockpit ‚Üí Value Mapping (Product object):

Review/maintain internal UoM ‚Üî ISO assignments in your tenant for migration reference.

If codes seem missing in the mapping task, consult KBA 3588262 (UoM missing on mapping task). SAP Support Portal

With best regards

Chuma
